p:
Alongside human-mediated long-distance dispersal, empirical studies have shown positive correlations between local human activities and the frequency of observation of invasive species
14– 16 . Numerous studies have concluded that invasive species are more likely to be established in areas of high human activity. Gravity models (a common approach to describe spatial expansion of invader species) often determine dispersal destination by levels of human activity, e.g., the number of incoming boats at a given port
17– 21 .
